results.title: Barry and the psycho doorstop salesman
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This work depicts an animated character, Barry, bored with commercial television. He happily accepts a video game sold to him by an overzealous door to door salesman. Barry becomes enraged when he finds that the game does not work and complains to the salesman the following day. Barry has made a big mistake…as the psychotic salesman stalks Barry and a violent tussle ensues in the dead of night. Barry finally finishes killing the salesman…or has he??

group_siblings.title: The Adventures of Buzz Boy & Buzz Girl
Would you like gravy with that?

results.title: The Adventures of Buzz Boy & Buzz Girl
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This animated short depicts the adventures between an evil bee and super hero insects. Dr. Bee has hypnotised Buzz Boy to steal for him, after poisoning a peanut and jelly sandwich. Buzz Girl finds out the truth and informs Buzz Boy. Together they set out in search of Dr.Bee. They find him and are caught up in a high speed chase which eventuates in Dr.Bee crashing into the side of a skyscraper.

results.title: Progress
results.brief_description:
This film gives a chronological account of the First Fleet’s arrival to Sydney Harbour bridge and it’s opening to the public; the construction of the Sydney Harbour Tunnel and it’s opening to the public.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Jirrupin Bunggul 'Happy Dance'
results.brief_description: Winner of the ‘Make a stamp come alive’ category of Screen It! This cool little work combines a thumping dance track with animation of the artwork depicted on an Australian stamp entitled ‘Aboriginal Culture: Music and Dance’. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Eureka
results.brief_description: Highly commended entry into the “Make a stamp come alive” category of Screen It! This film recounts the story of famous revolt in Ballarat and the subsequent discovery of gold. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Matthew Flinders
results.brief_description:
This film recounts the story of Flinders and Bass’ journey to Australia and describes their discoveries of Australian coastlines and Tasmania, all of which was to be recorded in a book written back in England by Flinders himself.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Freedom of the Boomerang
results.brief_description: Highly commended ” make a stamp come alive” entry to Screen It! A man visiting a post office unwittingly unleashes a magical boomerang into the world. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Expedition of T. Mitchell
results.brief_description:
The arrival of T.Mitchell from the United Kingdom to Australia with convicts in tow. Subsequently one morning, T.Mitchell awoke to find his camp robbed by the convicts.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Then and Now
results.brief_description: Recounts the story of the Gaganja tribe and of an Aboriginal elder’s experience of white people entering his land.It compares the early conflict of settlement with the situation in Australia today. Winner of the category “Create a moving image stamp story” An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Endangered
results.brief_description:
The following endangered species come to life from Australian stamps: Leadbeater’s Possum; Greater Bilby and the Stick Nest Rat. The film ends with a stamp depicting Australian Aboriginal, Truganini.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
